clinical_study.brief_title: Health Education vs. Health Education Plus Physical Therapy for Low Back Pain Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Health Education vs. Health Education Plus Physical Therapy for Low Back Pain Patients

collaborator.agency: Consejería de Sanidad, Junta de Castilla y León

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to assess the effectiveness of a brief educational program and of an additional program in physical therapy, for the treatment of low back pain in Primary Care of the Spanish National Health Service. This is a controlled, cluster randomized community trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Intensity of pain, measured at baseline, 90, and 180 days later
Disability, measured at baseline, 90, and 180 days later
Sick leave, measured at baseline, 90, and 180 days later

secondary_outcome.measure: Fear avoidance beliefs, measured at baseline, 90, and 180 days later
Quality of life, measured at baseline, 90, and 180 days later

arm_group.description: Routine clinical practice and talk on general health
Talk on back health and handout of The Back Book
Routine clinical practice, talk on back health, handout of The Back Book and back exercise

intervention.description: Routine clinical practice and talk on general health
Talk on health of the back and handout of The Back Book
Routine clinical practice, talk on back health, handout of The Back Book and back exercise
